newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Building, brewing shares rise on Nigerian bourse.
newsitem.headline: Building, brewing shares rise on Nigerian bourse.

text.p: Construction firms and breweries joined oil marketing companies to advance in active Tuesday trading on the Nigerian stock exchange.
The all-share index closed at 6,805.33 from 6,789.61 on Monday.
"Investors are just scouting around for shares that are well positioned to rise further in the new year," one trader said.
"They consider most blue chips too dear for now which is why there is renewed interest in these sectors," he added.
Construction firm Julius Berger rose 28 kobo to 7.60 naira, while G. Cappa went 25 kobo up at 11.00 naira. Cappa & D'Alberto added two kobo to 6.36 naira.
Nigerian Breweries gained 30 kobo to 16.10 naira and Guinness closed 10 kobo higher at 6.50 naira.
Agip's impressive half-year result continued to cheer the market and shares closed up 40 kobo at 19.50 naira. Texaco was 20 kobo higher at 31.20 naira while Total was 10 kobo up at 54.60 naira.
Nestle Foods led its sector rising 25 kobo to 45.85 naira and Union Dicon Salt finished 22 kobo up at 42.25 naira.
In the agriculture sector, Okomu Oil rose 15 kobo to 7.00 naira.
FSB International Bank was the sole riser in the group. It gained five kobo to 5.45 naira.
Cadbury fell 40 kobo to 23.90, while conglomerate CFAO was 10 kobo down at 3.40. Stationers Thomas Wyatt fell nine kobo to 6.80 naira.
